title: Dhruv Garg ‚Äî Portfolio Website
text:
This is the source for my personal portfolio website, built using Quarto, HTML, and CSS.
It showcases my: - Projects - Education - Experience - Resume - Contact links



‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.qmd           # Homepage
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ about.qmd           # About Me page
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ projects.qmd        # Listing page for all projects (auto or manual)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ resume.qmd          # Resume page (optional)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ education.qmd       # Education and certifications (new page)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ posts/              # Folder containing individual project pages
‚îÇ    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ project1.qmd
‚îÇ    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ project2.qmd
‚îÇ    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ ...
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ images/             # Images (logos, project screenshots, gifs)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ styles.css          # Custom CSS for layout and design
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ _quarto.yml         # Quarto site configuration
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md           # This file







The homepage contains cards for:

Projects
Education
Experience

Important: The ‚ÄúView Education‚Äù button links to education.qmd now, not about.qmd#education.


To add/change cards on the homepage, edit the <div class="portfolio-card"> blocks inside index.qmd.






projects.qmd lists projects automatically if you use the listing: feature.
Each project has a file inside the posts/ folder.
Example project file: posts/retailpulse.qmd


To add a new project, create a new .qmd inside posts/ and Quarto will pick it up.






education.qmd uses a stacked layout ‚Äî degrees first, certificates after.
To add a new degree or certificate:

Copy an <div class="education-item"> block.
Update the title, organization, year, and description.
(Optional) Add/update logos in images/.







Currently linked as a placeholder to about.qmd#experience.
If you want a full new Experience page later, create experience.qmd separately.






Main styling such as:

Card layout
Section headings
Button hover effects
Fonts and responsiveness

Edit styles.css to customize the look of cards, sections, or entire site theme.






Controls the navbar links, site title, theme, and external assets.
If you add a new major page like education.qmd or experience.qmd, consider adding it to _quarto.yml under navbar:.

Example:
website:
  navbar:
    left:
      - href: index.qmd
        text: Home
      - href: projects.qmd
        text: Projects
      - href: education.qmd
        text: Education
      - href: resume.qmd
        text: Resume





To deploy the portfolio:

Render the site locally:

quarto render

Push changes to GitHub.
Enable GitHub Pages:

Branch: gh-pages (if using quarto publish gh-pages)
Or use /docs folder if manually setting output-dir: docs in _quarto.yml.

Your live website will be at:

https://your-username.github.io/your-repo-name/











Task
Reminder




Adding new project
Create new .qmd inside posts/


Adding new degree/certificate
Add new block inside education.qmd


Adding experience
Create or update about.qmd


Updating styles
Modify styles.css


Updating site settings
Modify _quarto.yml


Deploy new changes
quarto render + Push to GitHub








Always keep images optimized (small size, high clarity).
Preview locally with quarto preview before pushing changes.
Keep naming consistent (lowercase filenames, no spaces).

title: Seoul Bike Share Predictor
text:
In this project, we aimed to build a Docker image from scratch and create a fully reproducible analysis pipeline for future use.
The primary goal was to learn and practice key software engineering tools, including:

Setting up Docker images
Implementing a CI/CD pipeline
Managing environments using Conda
Using make commands for workflow automation
Documenting the project using Quarto

We chose a simple dataset for this project, as the main focus was on understanding software tools rather than complex data modeling.



Rental bikes enhance urban mobility, but predicting their demand is crucial to maintaining a stable supply.
This project uses historical bike rental counts, weather information, and holiday data to forecast hourly bike demand in Seoul.
The dataset was sourced from the UCI Machine Learning Repository and described in studies by Sathishkumar V E, Jangwoo Park, and Yongyun Cho.

title: Number Theory Utilities for Project Euler
text:
üì¶ About the Package
num_theory is a high-performance Python package designed to simplify solving number theory problems ‚Äî especially those from Project Euler.
The primary goal of this project was to gain practical experience in creating and publishing an open-source Python package by following industry best practices.

title: Number Theory Utilities for Project Euler
text:
üìà Project Features
During the development of this package, we learned how to:

Manage dependencies using Poetry
Write and run unit tests
Set up a CI/CD pipeline to automatically publish to PyPI
Integrate code coverage reporting with Codecov
Structure projects using Cookiecutter templates
Host project documentation on ReadTheDocs

The package includes functionalities such as:

Fast prime number generation
Primality testing
Prime factorization
Arithmetic progression calculations
A clean and intuitive API for easy use

title: Vancouver Crime Statistics Dashboard
text:
For this project, I wanted to build a Shiny application from scratch.
I downloaded PDF reports from the Vancouver Police Department (VPD) portal and used a PDF extraction library to retrieve the crime data.
The extracted data was then processed and used to create this interactive dashboard.
This project helped me learn the basics of Shiny app development and gave me hands-on experience working with real-world data sources.



Crime statistics provide valuable insights into public safety and law enforcement effectiveness.
This dashboard is designed for policymakers, researchers, and local authorities to analyze crime trends across Vancouver neighborhoods.
Using the dashboard, users can:

Track crime trends over time

Compare crime types across neighborhoods

Analyze monthly crime patterns

Filter and explore data by date, location, and type

title: Vancouver Crime Statistics Dashboard
text:
üñ•Ô∏è App Overview
Built with Shiny in R, this dashboard offers an interactive platform for exploring Vancouver crime data.

Key Features

Neighborhood Selection ‚Äì choose one or multiple neighborhoods

Crime Type Filtering ‚Äì focus on specific crime categories

Date Range Selection ‚Äì filter data by time period

Dynamic Plot Selection ‚Äì switch between line and bar charts

Heatmap Visualization ‚Äì view monthly crime distributions

Interactive Data Table ‚Äì browse and search detailed records

title: RetailPulse: Online Retail Analytics Dashboard
text:
This project was primarily focused on learning how to use Dash to build interactive dashboards.
We also explored how to integrate Altair visualizations within Dash applications.



Retail operations managers often face challenges in managing inventory, tracking sales trends, and identifying market expansion opportunities.
Making informed, data-driven decisions quickly is crucial for maintaining a competitive edge.
RetailPulse was developed to address this need by providing an interactive dashboard that gives retailers real-time insights into their business performance.

title: About
text:
I‚Äôm Dhruv Garg, a Data Scientist with 3 years of hands-on industry experience and currently pursuing my Master of Data Science at the University of British Columbia. I specialize in designing and deploying machine learning solutions that deliver measurable business value ‚Äî particularly in marketing analytics and performance optimization.
Previously, I‚Äôve worked with startups and IT consultancies across North America, leading initiatives in large-scale data processing, LLM evaluation, marketing attribution modeling, and cloud-based ETL pipelines. My work has led to improved ROI, reduced infrastructure costs, and streamlined analytics workflows.
In addition to professional roles, I‚Äôve developed open-source packages and interactive dashboards as part of my academic projects, using tools like Dash, Docker, Quarto, and PySpark.
I‚Äôm passionate about building intelligent systems that are both scalable and human-centered ‚Äî and always open to collaborating on impactful data projects.
